definitions.definition: at the present time, not in the past or future:
examples: She used to be a teacher, but now she works in publishing.
I don't want to wait until tomorrow, I want it now!

definitions.definition: used to express how long something has been happening, from when it began to the present time:
examples: She's been a vegetarian for ten years now.

definitions.definition: used in stories or reports of past events to describe a new situation or event:
examples: It was getting dark now, and we were tired.

definitions.definition: used when describing a situation that is the result of what someone just said or did:
examples: Oh yes, now I know who you mean.
The guests are coming any minute now, and the house is still a mess.

definitions.definition: used to introduce a new subject:
examples: And now for what we're going to do tomorrow.
Now isn't a good time to speak to him.

definitions.definition: from this moment and always in the future:
examples: From now on the gates will be locked at midnight.
